humanum_full_description_en:
Oracle starts from "ÁõÆ" from ‚óé, ‚óé is the outer frame that encloses the "ÁõÆ", like the outline of the face, with eyes in the middle. The original meaning is face, face. "Said Wen": "The face, the face before the face. From the ¶£ª, like a human face. All faces are from the face."

Because the eyes are the most prominent organ of the face, Oracle uses "ÁõÆ" to represent the head. The oracle bone inscriptions may be derived from "person retains the shape of the human body." "Èù¢" is not seen in the bronze inscriptions, but there are characters with "Èù¢" as the radical. This word is not from "ÁõÆ" but from " ¶£ª " (the original word of "È¶ñ") From ‚óé, see Shi Yun Fang Yi. " Yan " and " mian " have the same meaning in ancient times, so the word " yan " starts from " mian " as the meaning symbol, see " mian ".

Oracle is used as the name of the country (see Xu Zhongshu). The strokes of the outer frame of the Chu bamboo slips were corrupted into " mortar ". " Mian " extended to mean facing, towards, "Shangbo Chu Zhushu II. "Rong Chengshi" Jane 14: "Yao south, Shun north."
humanum_short_description_en: The outline of an Oracle elephant face with eyes in the middle. The original meaning is face.

    Oracle starts from " ÁõÆ" from ‚óé, ‚óé is the outer frame that encloses the " ÁõÆ", like the outline of the face, with eyes in the middle. The original meaning is face, face. "Said Wen": "The face, the face before the face. From the ¶£ª, like a human face. All faces are from the face." Because the eyes are the most prominent organ of the face, Oracle uses " ÁõÆ" to represent the head. The oracle bone inscriptions may be derived from "person retains the shape of the human body." " Èù¢" is not seen in the bronze inscriptions, but there are characters with " Èù¢" as the radical. This word is not from " ÁõÆ" but from " ¶£ª" (the original word of " È¶ñ") From ‚óé, see Shi Yun Fang Yi. " Yan" and " mian" have the same meaning in ancient times, so the word " yan" starts from " mian" as the meaning symbol, see " mian". Oracle is used as the name of the country (see Xu Zhongshu). The strokes of the outer frame of the Chu bamboo slips were corrupted into " mortar". " Mian" extended to mean facing, towards, "Shangbo Chu Zhushu II. "Rong Chengshi" Jane 14: "Yao south, Shun north."
